result.execSummary:
The defendant Gustavo A Serate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.   Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Early termination by agent's petition after 2 yrs if all probation terms successful.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with def's children without authorization of Dane Co Human Services.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward CR.

Def to abide by all rules & conditions in Dane Co CHIPS cases 14JC36 & 14JC37. Cooperate with all juvenile court orders.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Reporter: Linda Flakne
J.R.duly sworn; testimony taken; Arguments heard; Ct binds case over; Ct Amends bond; Information filed but Arraignment to be scheduled by Br 15

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per count. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- If defendant posts $500 cash; still with BMP but no electronic bracelet after cash bond posted.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per count on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is review by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MJS and SMS and any other of your children
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence against Carolina R
- Defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact, direct or indirect, with any juveniles under the age of 18
- Defendant shall not be at the 7600 block of Carrington Drive in Madison WI
- Defendant shall not engage in the physical discipline of any child.
- No contact with Carolina R.  Defendant's family members may contact her regarding their own visitation with the children.

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Kristin K Shimabuku appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Jim Larson, interpreter, appeared.
